text:
When a user creates a projct and even after opening a file, no changes are 
saved. Best scenario would be to show a warning-dialog.
creator: Geert.Poels@skynet.be

text: JMeter doesn't save until you tell it to save.  What's the problem?
creator: mstover1@apache.org

text:
'Traditional' applications consider their 'state' to be changed as soon as the 
user changes anything to the current document/project/... .
In such a case, the user is asked if he wants to save his changes.
This should definitely be the case when he explicitely opens a file.
creator: Geert.Poels@skynet.be

text:
JMeter currently warns users when they close JMeter or when they select "new"
from the file menu if they have unsaved elements.  Is this what you are asking for?
creator: mstover1@apache.org
jsalvata@atg.com
text:
Marking all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8's release date as VERIFIED.
Yes, it's pretty poor QA procedure, but there's bugs here lingering since JMeter
1.6, and we need to clean up a little.

creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text: Bulk-closing all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8 release date.
